text: John Albert "Bertie" de Silva (19 January 1901 – 30 November 1981) was a cricketer who played five matches of first-class cricket for Oxford University in England between 1924 and 1927 and three matches for Dr J Rockwood's Ceylon XI in Ceylon between 1929 and 1930.Wisden 1983, p. 1244. He served in the Forest Department in Ceylon from 1927 to 1957, and was head of the department, with the title Conservator of Forests, from 1950 to 1957."Mr J. A. de Silva's Comments on Material from Pul Eliya", 1967."Obituaries", The Cricketer, April 1982, p. 72. ==References== ==External links== * * Category:1901 births Category:1981 deaths Category:Sri Lankan cricketers Category:Oxford University cricketers Category:All-Ceylon cricketers Category:Alumni of Trinity College, Kandy Category:Alumni of Keble College, Oxford Category:Cricketers from Colombo Category:Sinhalese civil servants Category:Foresters
